etymology.description: 我(我) (wǒ, "I"), 不(不) (bù, "not"), 知道(知道) (zhīdào, "know")
etymology.interpretation: The phrase 我不知道 (wǒ bù zhīdào) literally translates to "I not know," indicating a lack of knowledge or information about something. It is a straightforward phrase used to express not knowing or being unaware.

examples.chinese: 他问我答案(他問我答案)，我不知道(我不知道)。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèn wǒ dá'àn, wǒ bù zhīdào.
examples.english: He asks me for the answer, I don't know.

examples.chinese: 每次被问到问题时(每次被問到問題時)，我总是回答我不知道(我總是回答我不知道)。
examples.pinyin: Měi cì bèi wèn dào wèntí shí, wǒ zǒng shì huídá wǒ bù zhīdào.
examples.english: Every time I'm asked a question, I always reply 'I don't know.'
